skill.name: defi-protocol-templates
skill.description: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending systems. Use when building decentralized finance applications or smart contract protocols.
skill.summary: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only Solidity code examples in markdown. No executable scripts, network calls, file system access, or environment variable harvesting detected.

content.value_statement: You need solid DeFi contract templates but do not want to start from scratch. This skill provides ready-to-use structures for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending protocols that you can adapt quickly.
actual_capabilities: Provides a staking rewards contract with reward distribution logic
Provides a simple AMM with liquidity provision and swap functionality
Provides governance token and proposal voting system templates
Provides a flash loan provider and receiver example
Includes documentation for five DeFi protocol patterns
limitations: No tests or deployment scripts are included
Templates are unaudited and need review before production use
No price oracle or liquidation logic is provided
Referenced external docs and assets are not in this package

use_cases.title: Prototype a DeFi MVP
use_cases.description: Adapt staking and AMM templates to validate a new protocol idea quickly.

use_cases.title: Plan protocol scope
use_cases.description: Review governance and flash loan examples to define product requirements.

use_cases.title: Compare baseline patterns
use_cases.description: Use templates as a baseline to spot missing controls in custom code.

prompt_templates.title: Staking basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the staking rewards template and list the key state variables and events.

prompt_templates.title: AMM setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how addLiquidity and swap work in the AMM template and note any math assumptions.

prompt_templates.title: Governance flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the governance proposal lifecycle in the template and list where custom logic should go.

prompt_templates.title: Flash loan safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify security checks in the flash loan template and suggest two additional safeguards.

output_examples.input: Explain the AMM template and list the main functions.
output: The AMM tracks two token reserves and issues liquidity shares to providers.
Main functions are addLiquidity, removeLiquidity, and swap.
Prices follow a constant product model with a 0.3 percent fee on swaps.

best_practices: Add comprehensive unit tests before deploying any adapted template
Use audited OpenZeppelin libraries for token and access control logic
Review math for overflow and rounding edge cases in production
anti_patterns: Deploying templates without a professional security audit
Skipping access control and pause mechanisms for critical functions
Ignoring token decimal handling and fee edge cases

faq.question: What platforms are compatible?
faq.answer: Templates are Solidity based and work on EVM chains that support OpenZeppelin libraries.

faq.question: What are the limits of these templates?
faq.answer: They are minimal examples without full oracle, liquidation, or upgrade proxy logic.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my project?
faq.answer: Copy the contract and adapt interfaces, parameters, and access control for your needs.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data?
faq.answer: No. It contains static templates only with no data collection or external calls.

faq.question: What if compilation fails?
faq.answer: Check Solidity version compatibility and ensure OpenZeppelin dependencies are installed.

faq.question: How does this compare to full DeFi frameworks?
faq.answer: This is lighter and faster for prototyping but lacks complete production features.
